text.0: agni the bright face of the dawns is shining the singers pious voices have ascended.
text.1: borne on your chariot aśvins turn you hither and come unto our full and rich libation.
text.2: most frequent guests they scorn not what is ready even now the lauded aśvins are beside us.
text.3: with promptest aid they come at morn and evening the worshippers most blessed guards from trouble.
text.4: yea come at milkingtime at early morning at noon of day and when the sun is setting.
text.5: by day by night with favour most auspicious not only now the draught hath drawn the aśvins.
text.6: for this place aśvins was of old your dwelling these were your houses this your habitation.
text.7: come to us from high heaven and from the mountain come from the waters bringing food and vigour.
text.8: may we obtain the aśvins newest favour and gain their healthbestowing happy guidance.
text.9: bring riches hither unto us and heroes and all felicity and joy immortals.
